net.centro.rtb.monitoringcenter.metrics.system.jvm

Interface BufferPoolStatus


  • public interface BufferPoolStatus
    This interface represents the current readings for a JVM buffer pool. All metrics exposed by this class are immutable by the client.
    See Also:
    BufferPoolMXBean

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getName()
      Retrieves the name of the buffer pool.
      com.codahale.metrics.Gauge<Long> getSizeGauge()
      Retrieves an estimate of the number of buffers in the pool.
      com.codahale.metrics.Gauge<Long> getTotalCapacityInBytesGauge()
      Retrieves an estimate of the total capacity of buffers in the pool in bytes.
      com.codahale.metrics.Gauge<Long> getUsedMemoryInBytesGauge()
      Retrieves an estimate of the memory that the JVM is using for this buffer pool in bytes.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Retrieves the name of the buffer pool.
        Returns:
        the name of the buffer pool.

      • getSizeGauge

        com.codahale.metrics.Gauge<Long> getSizeGauge()
        Retrieves an estimate of the number of buffers in the pool.
        Returns:
        a gauge holding an estimate of the number of buffers in the pool.
        See Also:
        BufferPoolMXBean.getCount()

      • getTotalCapacityInBytesGauge

        com.codahale.metrics.Gauge<Long> getTotalCapacityInBytesGauge()
        Retrieves an estimate of the total capacity of buffers in the pool in bytes.
        Returns:
        a gauge holding an estimate of the total capacity of buffers in the pool in bytes.
        See Also:
        BufferPoolMXBean.getTotalCapacity()

      • getUsedMemoryInBytesGauge

        com.codahale.metrics.Gauge<Long> getUsedMemoryInBytesGauge()
        Retrieves an estimate of the memory that the JVM is using for this buffer pool in bytes.
        Returns:
        a gauge holding an estimate of the memory that the JVM is using for this buffer pool in bytes; null if not available.
        See Also:
        BufferPoolMXBean.getMemoryUsed()
